joint_involvement.justification: Patient facts mention polyarthrite rhumatoïde but no clinical or imaging evidence of joint involvement. Minimum plausible score is 0.

serology.justification: Both RF (positive at 87 UI/mL) and anti-CCP (positive at 67 U/mL) are high-positive, according to the ACR/EULAR guidelines for scoring serology. The threshold for a high-positive score is >3× ULN.

acute_phase.justification: C Reactive Protein (CRP) value of 41 mg/L indicates an abnormal CRP level, according to the clinical notes in ACR/EULAR guidelines.

duration.justification: No evidence provided for duration scoring. Minimum plausible score is 0.

treatment_context.justification: The presence of methotrexate (csDMARD) strongly suggests established RA.

classification_rationale: According to the ACR/EULAR criteria, a total score of 4 includes serology score of 3 from both RF and anti-CCP markers being high-positive, acute phase reactant (acute inflammation) score of 1 due to CRP elevation. The treatment context with methotrexate strongly suggests established RA. Therefore, the final label is RA+.
